title: The Last of Us Season 2 Episode 2 Release Date, Time, Where to Watch
description: The Last of Us Season 2 Episode 2 release date and time is just around the corner, and fans are anxious to learn all the information related to it. They also want to know how they can watch the episode online. In the previous episode, “Future Days,” Ellie and Dina made a shocking discovery while […] The post The Last of Us Season 2 Episode 2 Release Date, Time, Where to Watch appeared first on ComingSoon.net - Movie Trailers, TV & Streaming News, and More.
author: Abdul Azim Naushad
excerpt: Fans curious about The Last of Us Season 2 Episode 2's release date, time, and streaming details can find out more about it here.
siteName: ComingSoon.net - Movie Trailers, TV & Streaming News, and More
text: The Last of Us Season 2 Episode 2 release date and time is just around the corner, and fans are anxious to learn all the information related to it. They also want to know how they can watch the episode online. In the previous episode, “Future Days,” Ellie and Dina made a shocking discovery while on patrol. Meanwhile, Joel tried to get help to fix his strained relationship with Ellie. Here’s all you need to know. When is The Last of Us Season 2 Episode 2 release date & time? The episode’s release date is Sunday, April 20, 2025, and its release time is 9 p.m. Eastern Time (ET) and 6 p.m. Pacific Time (PT). Check out its release times in the U.S. below: TimezoneRelease DateRelease TimeEastern TimeApril 20, 202509:00 p.m.Pacific TimeApril 20, 202506:00 p.m. Find out how many episodes will be available to watch in The Last of Us Season 2 right here. Where to watch The Last of Us Season 2 Episode 2 You can watch The Last of Us Season 2 Episode 2 via HBO and HBO Max. HBO is a pay television service owned by Warner Bros. Discovery. Meanwhile, HBO Max, also owned by WB Discovery, is a subscription-based streaming service. HBO and Max both feature a plethora of film, television, animation, and documentary content, spanning genres. What is The Last of Us about? The Last of Us Season 2 is set five years after Season 1’s events. The story sees Ellie combat new threats, while also dealing with her strained relationship with Joel, who had lied to her about the events that occurred in Season 1’s finale. The official synopsis for The Last of Us is as follows: “Twenty years after modern civilization has been destroyed, Joel, a hardened survivor, is hired to smuggle Ellie, a 14-year-old girl, out of an oppressive quarantine zone. What starts as a small job soon becomes a brutal, heartbreaking journey, as they both must traverse the United States and depend on each other for survival.”
html:
The Last of Us Season 2 Episode 2 release date and time is just around the corner, and fans are anxious to learn all the information related to it. They also want to know how they can watch the episode online. In the previous episode, “Future Days,” Ellie and Dina made a shocking discovery while on patrol. Meanwhile, Joel tried to get help to fix his strained relationship with Ellie.

Here’s all you need to know.

When is The Last of Us Season 2 Episode 2 release date & time?

The episode’s release date is Sunday, April 20, 2025, and its release time is 9 p.m. Eastern Time (ET) and 6 p.m. Pacific Time (PT).

Check out its release times in the U.S. below:

Find out how many episodes will be available to watch in The Last of Us Season 2 right here.

Where to watch The Last of Us Season 2 Episode 2

You can watch The Last of Us Season 2 Episode 2 via HBO and HBO Max.

HBO is a pay television service owned by Warner Bros. Discovery. Meanwhile, HBO Max, also owned by WB Discovery, is a subscription-based streaming service. HBO and Max both feature a plethora of film, television, animation, and documentary content, spanning genres.

What is The Last of Us about?

The Last of Us Season 2 is set five years after Season 1’s events. The story sees Ellie combat new threats, while also dealing with her strained relationship with Joel, who had lied to her about the events that occurred in Season 1’s finale.

The official synopsis for The Last of Us is as follows:

“Twenty years after modern civilization has been destroyed, Joel, a hardened survivor, is hired to smuggle Ellie, a 14-year-old girl, out of an oppressive quarantine zone. What starts as a small job soon becomes a brutal, heartbreaking journey, as they both must traverse the United States and depend on each other for survival.”
